history.content: It could be many things - the class was probably expanded or the people on the waitlist above you either had time conflicts or hit the unit cap for Phase I. Regardless, I feel that you need not worry. Once you get in, you wouldn't be removed :)

children.subject: Fair enough, I'm just a little confused, since the waitlist still has 93 people on it right now, so the class is not expanded and I doubt all 93 people on the waitlist had time conflicts, seems a little weird...
The waitlist is only processing EECS/CS majors during phase 1, maybe that helped a bit?
I'm in the same situation as you. Perhaps people are skipping the waitlist by swapping in directly?
That doesn't seem like it should be a feature at all though...it seems like it would be more of a bug.
I've heard of multiple people getting into 194-129 from the waitlist through swapping, but anecdotal evidence doesn't hold much weight

FYI, anyone who used the swap to get into the class when there was already a waitlist should not have gotten into the class. If the system were working

properly they should have been added to the bottom of the waitlist.

The class originally had 80-90 total seats and was expanded to 110 seats after 80 people enrolled and the waitlist started. Since then 23 additional people have managed to enroll in the class and bypass the waitlist (total 103 enrolled as of Nov 02). The only way we know this is possible so far is by exploiting the swap feature in CalCentral. So unless another explanation is produced I'd assume it's very likely that all the people after the first 80 used swap to get into the class. There is now a ticket submitted for the system to be fixed to prevent this, and for the people who bypassed the waitlist in this way to be moved to an appropriate position on the waitlist. 

If you are one of the first 30 people on the waitlist you would have gotten into the class once the waitlist began to process as long as you met any requirements. If you meet this criteria you are possibly being cheated out of your spot in the class by students who exploited the swap feature regardless if they did so knowingly or not.

Are you saying that CalCentral will remove the students from the class as a result of the ticket submission or are you saying that that is what you think should happen? (Basically, are you saying that it will happen or that you think it should happen?). Also, is there a way to check on the progress of this ticket?

I was number 15 on the waitlist and it looks like the class was expanded by around 20, but I'm still number 15 on the waitlist. I do not have any time conflicts and I am not at the Unit cap for Phase I and am an EECS major, so the above explanations don't seem plausible.
actually -- disregard this, I think I was just confused

+1 this happened to me for 126

swapped directly in despite a rather large waitlist
I've heard of a lot of people that swapped in. This seems quite unfair?

See This thread too: https://piazza.com/class/hyq0br1u3kx7dg?cid=5251.

If you are on the waitlist you now have a pretty low chance of getting into the class because people exploited the swap feature to bypass the waitlist. If you are position 30 or lower on the waitlist you would almost certainly have gotten into the class because they expanded it to 110 seats but then those seats filled up with people exploiting the swap. 

Please enter a ticket if you are affected, and make sure to ask them to prioritizing fixing the data so that people who used the swap to bypass the waitlist are moved to the back of the waitlist, since that's more important than fixing the bug at this time. Fixing the bug now won't have any effect until Phase I in the summer. Pasting here Nicole's comment from the thread I linked above: 

Nicole Evans McIntyre 3 days ago Yep, I'm sure having more people report it will help: 
E-mail:  sishelp@berkeley.edu
Call: 510-664-9000 (then select 6 from the menu)
Submit a ticket: https://berkeley.service-now.com/ess/create_incident
- In the “Affected Service” section, please choose “SIS - Student Information Systems”

history.content:
So I had gotten on the waitlist for CS 194-129 as a swap for another class I was already enrolled in just earlier today and was 96 on the waitlist. I somehow just got into the class, despite the fact that it seems like many other people are still on the waitlist and the class size/anything doesn't seem to have expanded.

Why might this have happened..I was just wondering if there is maybe a bug or something that caused this? I don't want the bug to be discovered/corrected later and dropped from 194, because I'll be losing the spot I had in my other class that CS 194 was swapped in for.
history.subject: Swapped into CS 194-129 from waitlist despite class size not increasing
